cards.name: Relentless Assault
cards.text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
cards.flavor: "Mercy? Mercy is for the playground, not the battleground."

rulings.text: If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

cards.originalText: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.

cards.name: Rockslide Elemental
cards.text:
First strike
Whenever another creature dies, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Rockslide Elemental.
cards.flavor: On Jund, even the landscape is a deadly hunter. Volcanoes, tar pits, and rock slides seem to prey upon the living.
cards.originalText:
First strike
Whenever another creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Rockslide Elemental.

cards.name: Rolling Thunder
cards.text: Rolling Thunder deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.
cards.flavor: "Such rage," thought Vhati, gazing up at the thunderhead from the Predator. "It is Greven's mind manifest."

rulings.text: If X is greater than 0, you can't choose zero targets. You must choose between one and X targets. If X is 0, you can't choose any targets.
You choose how many targets Rolling Thunder has and how the damage is divided as you cast the spell. Each target must receive at least 1 damage.

If some, but not all, of the targets become illegal by the time Rolling Thunder tries to resolve, the original division of damage still applies, but no damage is dealt to illegal targets. If all the targets are illegal, the spell won't resolve.
If Rolling Thunder is copied, the copy will retain the original damage divsion. The spell or ability will likely allow you to choose new targets, but you can't change the way damage is divided.

cards.originalText: Rolling Thunder deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Rorix Bladewing
cards.text: Flying, haste
cards.flavor: In the smoldering ashes of Shiv, a few dragons strive to rebuild their native land. The rest seek any opportunity to restore the broken pride of their race.
cards.originalText: Flying, haste

cards.name: Smokebraider
cards.text: {T}: Add two mana in any combination of colors. Spend this mana only to cast Elemental spells or activate abilities of Elementals.
cards.flavor: "Be silent and listen to your inner fire. Only then can you walk the Path of Flame."

rulings.text: The mana can be two mana of the same color, or one mana of each of two different colors. The mana can't be colorless.
You can use this mana to pay an alternative cost (such as evoke) or additional cost incurred while casting an Elemental spell. It's not limited to just that spell's mana cost.
The mana can't be spent to activate activated abilities of Elemental sources that aren't on the battlefield.

cards.originalText: {T}: Add two mana in any combination of colors to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast Elemental spells or activate abilities of Elementals.

cards.name: Taurean Mauler
cards.text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type.)
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Taurean Mauler.
cards.flavor: The power of a waterfall. The fury of an avalanche. The intellect of a gale-force wind.
cards.originalText:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Taurean Mauler.

cards.name: Beast Hunt
cards.text: Reveal the top three cards of your library. Put all creature cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Surely we could tame something besides hurdas and pillarfield oxen!"
—Sheyda, Ondu gamekeeper

rulings.text: If there are three or fewer cards in your library, you'll reveal all of them.

cards.originalText: Reveal the top three cards of your library. Put all creature cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

cards.name: Briarhorn
cards.text:
Flash
When Briarhorn enters the battlefield, target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
Evoke {1}{G} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

rulings.text: If you cast this card for its evoke cost, you may put the sacrifice trigger and the regular enters-the-battlefield trigger on the stack in either order. The one put on the stack last will resolve first.

cards.originalText:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Briarhorn enters the battlefield, target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
Evoke {1}{G} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

cards.name: Explosive Vegetation
cards.text: Search your library for up to two basic land cards, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Torching Krosa would be pointless. It grows faster than it burns.
cards.originalText: Search your library for up to two basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Fertile Ground
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional one mana of any color.
cards.originalText:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana of any color to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

cards.name: Fertilid
cards.text:
Fertilid enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}{G}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Fertilid: Target player searches their library for a basic land card, puts it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffles their library.

rulings.text: Although the targeted player doesn't need to find a basic land card if they don't want to, that player must shuffle their library.

cards.originalText:
Fertilid enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}{G}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Fertilid: Target player searches his or her library for a basic land card and puts it onto the battlefield tapped. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Forgotten Ancient
cards.text:
Whenever a player casts a spell, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Forgotten Ancient.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may move any number of +1/+1 counters from Forgotten Ancient onto other creatures.
cards.flavor: Its blood is life. Its body is growth.

rulings.text: It does not get counters for copies of spells (as with Storm), just for spells that are actually cast.
The moving of counters is not a targeted ability.
You decide how many counters to move and where to move them when the ability resolves.
Putting on a counter is optional. If you forget to do so, it means you chose not to do so.

cards.originalText:
Whenever a player casts a spell, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Forgotten Ancient.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may move any number of +1/+1 counters from Forgotten Ancient onto other creatures.

cards.name: Ivy Elemental
cards.text: Ivy Elemental enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
cards.flavor: In the gardens of the centaurs, many travelers have mysteriously vanished while admiring the elaborate topiaries.
cards.originalText: Ivy Elemental enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.name: Living Hive
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Living Hive deals combat damage to a player, create that many 1/1 green Insect creature tokens.
cards.flavor: In its center is a single red ant, a queen that regulates the hive's movements.
cards.originalText:
Trample
Whenever Living Hive deals combat damage to a player, put that many 1/1 green Insect creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Rampant Growth
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Nature grows solutions to its problems.

rulings.text: The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Search for Tomorrow
cards.text:
Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
Suspend 2—{G} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {G} and exile it with two time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)

rulings.text: You can exile a card in your hand using suspend any time you could cast that card. Consider its card type, any effect that affects when you could cast it (such as flash) and any other effects that could stop you from casting it (such as Meddling Mage's effect) to determine if and when you can do this. Whether or not you could actually complete all steps in casting the card is irrelevant. For example, you can exile a card with suspend that has no mana cost or requires a target even if no legal targets are available at that time.
Exiling a card with suspend isn't casting that card. This action doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to.
If the spell requires any targets, those targets are chosen when the spell is finally cast, not when it's exiled.
If the first triggered ability of suspend (the one that removes time counters) is countered, no time counter is removed. The ability will trigger again during the card's owner's next upkeep.
When the last time counter is removed, the second triggered ability of suspend will trigger. It doesn't matter why the last time counter was removed or what effect removed it.
If the second triggered ability of suspend (the one that lets you cast the card) is countered, the card can't be cast. It remains exiled with no time counters on it, and it's no longer suspended.
As the second triggered ability resolves, you must cast the card if able. Timing restrictions based on the card's type are ignored.
If you can't cast the card, perhaps because there are no legal targets available, it remains exiled with no time counters on it, and it's no longer suspended.

If the spell has any mandatory additional costs, you must pay those if able. However, if an additional cost includes a mana payment, you are forced to pay that cost only if there's enough mana in your mana pool at the time you cast the spell. You aren't forced to activate any mana abilities, although you may do so if you wish.
A creature cast using suspend will enter the battlefield with haste. It will have haste until another player gains control of it (or, in some rare cases, gains control of the creature spell itself).

cards.originalText:
Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
Suspend 2—{G} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {G} and exile it with two time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Silverglade Elemental
cards.text: When Silverglade Elemental enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. If you do, shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: When Silverglade Elemental enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Tornado Elemental
cards.text:
When Tornado Elemental enters the battlefield, it deals 6 damage to each creature with flying.
You may have Tornado Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.originalText:
When Tornado Elemental enters the battlefield, it deals 6 damage to each creature with flying.
You may have Tornado Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

cards.name: Tribal Unity
cards.text: Creatures of the creature type of your choice get +X/+X until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Kamahl left the violence of his former life behind him, but he still believes in the power of muscle.
cards.originalText: Creatures of the creature type of your choice get +X/+X until end of turn.

cards.name: Verdant Force
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
cards.flavor: Left to itself, nature overflows any container, overthrows any restriction, and overreaches any boundary.

rulings.text: In Two-Headed Giant, triggers only once per upkeep, not once for each player.
Verdant Force's ability triggers at the beginning of each upkeep, not just each of your upkeeps.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each upkeep, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Boros Swiftblade
cards.text: Double strike
cards.flavor: When the Boros Legion attacks, swiftblades enter the fray first. They pick off the archers and mages, softening the enemy front before the flame-kin and giants go in.
cards.originalText: Double strike (This creature deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

cards.name: Branching Bolt
cards.text:
Choose one or both —
• Branching Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature with flying.
• Branching Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature without flying.
cards.flavor:
"Lightning lives in everything, in living flesh and growing things. It must be set free."
—Rakka Mar

rulings.text: You may choose just the first mode (targeting a creature with flying), just the second mode (targeting a creature without flying), or both modes (targeting a creature with flying and a creature without flying). You can't choose a mode unless there's a legal target for it.

cards.originalText: Choose one or both — Branching Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature with flying; and/or Branching Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature without flying.

cards.name: Bull Cerodon
cards.text: Vigilance, haste
cards.flavor: It holds motionless vigil, watching Naya in silence through the screen of the whitecover. When it senses anything amiss, it launches forward with the uncanny sound of torn fog.
cards.originalText: Vigilance, haste

cards.name: Captain's Maneuver
cards.text: The next X damage that would be dealt to target creature, planeswalker, or player this turn is dealt to another target creature, planeswalker, or player instead.
cards.flavor: Sisay discovered that the mirrored hull of the Weatherlight could be used as a defensive weapon.

rulings.text: If the second target is no longer on the battlefield, or if the second target is no longer a creature, player, or planeswalker when the damage would be redirected, the damage is dealt to the first target as if this spell was not cast.
If the first target is no longer on the battlefield, then the damage will not be dealt at all, so it can't be redirected by this ability.

cards.originalText: The next X damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn is dealt to another target creature or player instead.

cards.name: Cerodon Yearling
cards.text: Vigilance, haste
cards.flavor: The unit of measurement used to chart a cerodon's growth is "persons consumed."
cards.originalText: Vigilance, haste

cards.name: Fires of Yavimaya
cards.text:
Creatures you control have haste.
Sacrifice Fires of Yavimaya: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Creatures you control have haste.
Sacrifice Fires of Yavimaya: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Glory of Warfare
cards.text:
As long as it's your turn, creatures you control get +2/+0.
As long as it's not your turn, creatures you control get +0/+2.
cards.flavor: "Their hopes dashed on our shields! Their victory slashed by our swords!"

rulings.text: There is never a point at which Glory of Warfare will give a creature you control +2/+2 or +0/+0. A creature that's normally 1/1, for example, will change from being 3/1 to being 1/3 when your turn ends and another player's turn begins. At no time will it be 3/3 or 1/1.

cards.originalText:
As long as it's your turn, creatures you control get +2/+0.
As long as it's not your turn, creatures you control get +0/+2.

cards.name: Hull Breach
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target artifact.
• Destroy target enchantment.
• Destroy target artifact and target enchantment.
cards.flavor: "Crovax knows we're coming now," said a grinning Sisay. "I just sent the Predator crashing into his stronghold."
cards.originalText: Choose one — Destroy target artifact; or destroy target enchantment; or destroy target artifact and target enchantment.

cards.name: Lightning Helix
cards.text: Lightning Helix deals 3 damage to any target and you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: Though less well-known than its army of soldiers, the Boros Legion's mage-priests are as respected by the innocent as they are hated by the ghosts of the guilty.

rulings.text: If the chosen target is illegal when Lightning Helix tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't gain 3 life.

cards.originalText: Lightning Helix deals 3 damage to target creature or player and you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Mage Slayer
cards.text:
Whenever equipped creature attacks, it deals damage equal to its power to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.
Equip {3}
cards.flavor:
"When the wielder is strong enough, any sword will do."
—Kresh the Bloodbraided

rulings.text: This ability triggers and resolves in the declare attackers step. The creature will still deal its combat damage as normal later on during the combat phase.

When the equipped creature attacks, the first ability will trigger. When that ability resolves, that creature will deal damage equal to its power to player or planeswalker it's attacking, even if Mage Slayer has left the battlefield or is equipping a different creature by that time.

cards.originalText:
Whenever equipped creature attacks, it deals damage equal to its power to defending player.
Equip {3}

cards.name: Razia, Boros Archangel
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance, haste
{T}: The next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature you control this turn is dealt to another target creature instead.
cards.flavor: Her sword burns with such brightness that foes avert their eyes and arrows divert their paths.

rulings.text: The 3 damage doesn't have to be from the same source, and it doesn't have to be all dealt at once. If only 2 damage is redirected, the next 1 damage will also be redirected.
If either target creature leaves the battlefield before damage is dealt, that damage won't be redirected. It doesn't matter if Razia leaves the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Flying, vigilance, haste
{T}: The next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature you control this turn is dealt to another target creature instead.

cards.name: Rumbling Slum
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Rumbling Slum deals 1 damage to each player.
cards.flavor: The Orzhov contract the Izzet to animate slum districts and banish them to the wastes. The Gruul adopt them and send them back to the city for vengeance.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, Rumbling Slum deals 1 damage to each player.

cards.name: Savage Twister
cards.text: Savage Twister deals X damage to each creature.
cards.flavor:
"Frozen, we watched the funnel pluck up three of the goats—pook! pook! pook!—before we ran for the wadi."
—Travelogue of Najat
cards.originalText: Savage Twister deals X damage to each creature.

cards.name: Sludge Strider
cards.text: Whenever another artifact enters the battlefield under your control or another artifact you control leaves the battlefield, you may pay {1}. If you do, target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Underneath the cities of Esper are cycles of life unseen by those who feed them.

rulings.text: If Sludge Strider and another artifact enter the battlefield under your control at the same time, Sludge Strider's triggered ability will trigger. Similarly, if Sludge Strider and another artifact you control leave the battlefield at the same time, Sludge Strider's triggered ability will trigger.

If an artifact creature with 0 toughness enters the battlefield under your control, Sludge Strider's ability will trigger a total of twice: Once when that creature enters the battlefield, and once when it's put into a graveyard. Both abilities will be put on the stack after the state-based action check that puts the 0-toughness creature into the graveyard is finished.

cards.originalText: Whenever another artifact enters the battlefield under your control or another artifact you control leaves the battlefield, you may pay {1}. If you do, target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Arsenal Thresher
cards.text: As Arsenal Thresher enters the battlefield, you may reveal any number of other artifact cards from your hand. Arsenal Thresher enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each card revealed this way.

rulings.text: If multiple Arsenal Threshers are entering the battlefield at the same time (for example, if Warp World is resolving), you may reveal the same artifact cards from your hand for each of them.

If Arsenal Thresher and another artifact are entering the battlefield from your hand at the same time, you may reveal that other artifact for Arsenal Thresher. If that artifact is a second Arsenal Thresher, you may reveal each Arsenal Thresher for the other.

cards.originalText: As Arsenal Thresher enters the battlefield, you may reveal any number of other artifact cards from your hand. Arsenal Thresher enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each card revealed this way.

cards.name: Balefire Liege
cards.text:
Other red creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other white creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever you cast a red spell, Balefire Liege deals 3 damage to target player or planeswalker.
Whenever you cast a white spell, you gain 3 life.

rulings.text: The abilities are separate and cumulative. If another creature you control is both of the listed colors, it will get a total of +2/+2.

cards.originalText:
Other red creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other white creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever you cast a red spell, Balefire Liege deals 3 damage to target player.
Whenever you cast a white spell, you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Battlegate Mimic
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell that's both red and white, Battlegate Mimic has base power and toughness 4/2 until end of turn and gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Mimics don't need perfect disguises. They need only the perfect victims: the naive, the young, or the poor of sight.

rulings.text: The ability triggers whenever you cast a spell that's both of its listed colors. It doesn't matter whether that spell also happens to be any other colors.

If you cast a spell that's the two appropriate colors for the second time in a turn, the ability triggers again. The Mimic will once again become the power and toughness stated in its ability, which could overwrite power- and toughness-setting effects that have been applied to it in the meantime.
Any other abilities the Mimic may have gained are not affected.

The effect from the ability overwrites other effects that set power and/or toughness if and only if those effects existed before the ability resolved. It will not overwrite effects that modify power or toughness (whether from a static ability, counters, or a resolved spell or ability), nor will it overwrite effects that set power and toughness which come into existence after the ability resolves. Effects that switch the creature's power and toughness are always applied after any other power or toughness changing effects, including this one, regardless of the order in which they are created.

cards.originalText: Whenever you cast a spell that's both red and white, Battlegate Mimic becomes 4/2 and gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Boros Guildmage
cards.text:
{1}{R}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
{1}{W}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
{1}{R}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
{1}{W}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Double Cleave
cards.text: Target creature gains double strike until end of turn. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
cards.flavor: "When in doubt, kill 'em twice."
cards.originalText: Target creature gains double strike until end of turn. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

cards.name: Duergar Hedge-Mage
cards.text:
When Duergar Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Mountains, you may destroy target artifact.
When Duergar Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Plains, you may destroy target enchantment.

rulings.text: Each of the triggered abilities has an "intervening 'if' clause." That means (1) the ability won't trigger at all unless you control two or more lands of the appropriate land type when the Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, and (2) the ability will do nothing if you don't control two or more lands of the appropriate land type by the time it resolves.
Both abilities trigger at the same time. You can put them on the stack in any order.
Each of the triggered abilities look at your lands individually. This means that if you only control two dual-lands of the appropriate types, both of the abilities will trigger.
Both abilities are optional; you choose whether to use them when they resolve. If an ability has a target, you must choose a target even if you don't plan to use the ability.

cards.originalText:
When Duergar Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Mountains, you may destroy target artifact.
When Duergar Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Plains, you may destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Hearthfire Hobgoblin
cards.text: Double strike
cards.flavor: Hobgoblins are best left alone. They sharpen their farm implements far more than is necessary for their work in the fields.
cards.originalText: Double strike (This creature deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

cards.name: Assault
cards.text: Assault deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.originalText: Assault deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Battery
cards.text: Create a 3/3 green Elephant creature token.
cards.originalText: Put a 3/3 green Elephant creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Order
cards.text: Exile target attacking creature.
cards.originalText: Exile target attacking creature.

cards.name: Chaos
cards.text: Creatures can't block this turn.
cards.originalText: Creatures can't block this turn.

cards.name: Arcbound Crusher
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever another artifact enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on Arcbound Crusher.
Modular 1 (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)

rulings.text: If this creature gets enough -1/-1 counters put on it to cause its toughness to be 0 or less (or the damage marked on it to be lethal), modular will put a number of +1/+1 counters on the target artifact creature equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on this creature before it left the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Trample
Whenever another artifact enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on Arcbound Crusher.
Modular 1 (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. When it's put into a graveyard, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)

cards.name: Arcbound Slith
cards.text:
Whenever Arcbound Slith deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Modular 1 (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)

rulings.text: If this creature gets enough -1/-1 counters put on it to cause its toughness to be 0 or less (or the damage marked on it to be lethal), modular will put a number of +1/+1 counters on the target artifact creature equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on this creature before it left the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Whenever Arcbound Slith deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Modular 1 (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. When it's put into a graveyard, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)

cards.name: Boros Signet
cards.flavor:
"Have you ever held a Boros signet? There's a weight to it that belies its size—a weight of strength and of pride."
—Agrus Kos
cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: Add {R}{W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Bosh, Iron Golem
cards.text:
Trample
{3}{R}, Sacrifice an artifact: Bosh, Iron Golem deals damage equal to the sacrificed artifact's converted mana cost to any target.
cards.flavor: As Glissa searches for the truth about Memnarch, Bosh searches to unearth the secrets of his past.
cards.originalText:
Trample
{3}{R}, Sacrifice an artifact: Bosh, Iron Golem deals damage equal to the sacrificed artifact's converted mana cost to target creature or player.

cards.name: Copper Myr
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavor: The elves thought of the myr as minor threats, just as the myr thought of the elves.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Cranial Plating
cards.originalText:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.
{B}{B}: Attach Cranial Plating to target creature you control.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Darksteel Forge
cards.text: Artifacts you control have indestructible. (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy them. Artifact creatures with indestructible can't be destroyed by damage.)
cards.flavor:
"Did it have this shape upon Mirrodin's creation, or did some inconceivable force shape the unshapable?"
—Pontifex, elder researcher
cards.originalText: Artifacts you control are indestructible. (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy them. Indestructible creatures can't be destroyed by damage.)

cards.name: Door to Nothingness
cards.text:
Door to Nothingness enters the battlefield tapped.
{W}{W}{U}{U}{B}{B}{R}{R}{G}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Door to Nothingness: Target player loses the game.
cards.flavor:
"All memory of your existence will be wiped from reality. You will die, and no one will mourn."
—Memnarch
cards.originalText:
Door to Nothingness enters the battlefield tapped.
{W}{W}{U}{U}{B}{B}{R}{R}{G}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Door to Nothingness: Target player loses the game.

cards.name: Etched Oracle
cards.text:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
{1}, Remove four +1/+1 counters from Etched Oracle: Target player draws three cards.
cards.originalText:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
{1}, Remove four +1/+1 counters from Etched Oracle: Target player draws three cards.

cards.name: Gold Myr
cards.text: {T}: Add {W}.
cards.flavor: The leonin thought of the myr as omens, never imagining the sinister fate they foretold.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Iron Myr
cards.text: {T}: Add {R}.
cards.flavor: The goblins didn't think of the myr at all, which allowed the myr to observe everywhere unhindered.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Leaden Myr
cards.text: {T}: Add {B}.
cards.flavor: The Moriok saw the myr as fellow scavengers, never knowing just who the myr were scavenging for.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Lodestone Myr
cards.text:
Trample
Tap an untapped artifact you control: Lodestone Myr gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: When necessary, myr can override and control any artificial object, as can their creator.
cards.originalText:
Trample
Tap an untapped artifact you control: Lodestone Myr gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Loxodon Warhammer
cards.text:

Equip {3}
cards.originalText:
Equipped creature gets +3/+0 and has lifelink and trample.

cards.name: Mask of Memory
cards.text:
Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage to a player, you may draw two cards. If you do, discard a card.
Equip {1}
cards.originalText:
Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage to a player, you may draw two cards. If you do, discard a card.
Equip {1}

cards.name: Myr Enforcer
cards.text: Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
cards.flavor: Most myr monitor other species. Some myr monitor other myr.
cards.originalText: Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)

cards.name: Nuisance Engine
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Create a 0/1 colorless Pest artifact creature token.
cards.flavor: All Auriok children know the tale, "Bolgri and the Long Day of Squashing."
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Put a 0/1 colorless Pest artifact creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Pentad Prism
cards.text:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a charge counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
Remove a charge counter from Pentad Prism: Add one mana of any color.
cards.originalText:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a charge counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
Remove a charge counter from Pentad Prism: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Pentavus
cards.text:
Pentavus enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Pentavus: Create a 1/1 colorless Pentavite artifact creature token with flying.
{1}, Sacrifice a Pentavite: Put a +1/+1 counter on Pentavus.

rulings.text: You can remove any +1/+1 counter on Pentavus to activate its first activated ability, not just ones created by Pentavus's other abilities.

You can sacrifice any Pentavite creature you control (such as an Adaptive Automaton with Pentavite as its chosen type) to activate Pentavus's second activated ability, not just ones created by Pentavus's other abilities.

cards.originalText:
Pentavus enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Pentavus: Put a 1/1 colorless Pentavite artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
{1}, Sacrifice a Pentavite: Put a +1/+1 counter on Pentavus.

cards.name: Relic of Progenitus
cards.text:
{T}: Target player exiles a card from their graveyard.
{1}, Exile Relic of Progenitus: Exile all cards from all graveyards. Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Elves believe the hydra-god Progenitus sleeps beneath Naya, feeding on forgotten magics.

rulings.text: If you activate Relic of Progenitus's first ability, the targeted player chooses which card to exile. The choice is made as the ability resolves.
You can activate Relic of Progenitus's second ability even if no players have any cards in their graveyards. You'll still draw a card.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Target player exiles a card from his or her graveyard.
{1}, Exile Relic of Progenitus: Exile all cards from all graveyards. Draw a card.

cards.name: Serum Tank
cards.text:
Whenever Serum Tank or another artifact enters the battlefield, put a charge counter on Serum Tank.
{3}, {T}, Remove a charge counter from Serum Tank: Draw a card.
cards.originalText:
Whenever Serum Tank or another artifact enters the battlefield, put a charge counter on Serum Tank.
{3}, {T}, Remove a charge counter from Serum Tank: Draw a card.

cards.name: Silver Myr
cards.text: {T}: Add {U}.
cards.flavor: The vedalken saw the myr as toys, unaware of the intelligence lurking behind their empty eyes.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Skeleton Shard
cards.text: {3}, {T} or {B}, {T}: Return target artifact creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Metal permeates the marrow of every bone in Mephidross—except one.

rulings.text: You can pay either of the two costs (but not both at the same time) to activate the ability.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T} or {B}, {T}: Return target artifact creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Suntouched Myr
cards.text: Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
cards.flavor: As the fifth sun joins the other four, new abilities awaken in the creatures of Mirrodin.
cards.originalText: Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)

cards.name: Boros Garrison
cards.text:
Boros Garrison enters the battlefield tapped.
When Boros Garrison enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Cabal Coffers
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Add {B} for each Swamp you control.
cards.flavor: Deep within the Cabal's vault, the Mirari pulsed like a dead sun—and its darkness radiated across Otaria.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool for each Swamp you control.

cards.name: Sunhome, Fortress of the Legion
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{2}{R}{W}, {T}: Target creature gains double strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Sunhome—the stalwart shield, the towering sentinel, the seat of justice.

rulings.text: If you give double strike to a creature with first strike after first-strike combat damage has been dealt, that creature will also deal damage during the normal combat damage step.
If you give double strike to a creature after either first-strike or normal combat damage has been dealt, it won't help that creature deal any additional combat damage.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{2}{R}{W}, {T}: Target creature gains double strike until end of turn. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
